  <strong style="display: block;">The primary reason that a portfolio's risk declines as more stocks are added is that:</strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q6" value="A"> A. The systematic risk of each new stock is cancelled out by the systematic risk of existing stocks.</label><br>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q6" value="C"> C. The firm-specific (unsystematic) risks of each company, which are independent, tend to average out.</label><br>
  <label><input type="radio" name="module2_mcq_q6" value="D"> D. The portfolio's expected return decreases, making it inherently less risky.</label><br>
